Our models predicted this. A second line of defence for the mother - less refined and more brutish. Careful amalgamations of silica and elements, charged by anima and given a shambling semblance of existence. They are strong, they are efficient and they have no place in our models. 
Everything we know points to them appearing in places of where the filth has been spotted - all the anomalies that you have been investigating, in other words. Transylvania and Egypt and Solomon Island - probably Tokyo as well, but you don't have clearance to go there yet.
Our data set needs cleaning up. Remove these elements whenever you encounter them.

3503.Report:
Our models predicted this. A second line of defence for the mother - less refined and more brutish. Careful amalgamations of silica and elements, charged by anima and given a shambling semblance of existence. They are strong, they are efficient and they have no place in our models.

3511.Report:
Accept whatever tidings these envoys of Venice may give you. Bow and walk away. Give them no reason to suspect that our distrust of the Council grows.
They are certainly compromised, though it isn’t clear to what extent. As their power wanes – as their buildings sink – they will inevitably grasp at anything and everything to stay afloat.
We have reason to believe that both the Phoenicians and the Templars have extended their hands. Drowning men seeking to save themselves by pretending to save each other.
Better just to swim.

3512.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3513.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3514.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3515.Report: I cannot tell if Daimon's random request is his way of making puerile mockery of our models…or if it serves a genuine purpose. Keep observing, and let me know of all of his actions, no matter how trivial.

3516.Report: Underworlds form like barnacles on every environment. It is all part of the pattern. You can change the environment, travel to whole new dimensions of the cosmos, where even the laws of physics lethally differ, and a creature used to the underworld of one model will swim gracefully in the underworld of the other. Inbeda is quite at home here. He knows the rules, he adjusts to the model of organised crime. His demon-kin even have working contracts and protection money exchanges with the Korinto-kai. The inverse must hold true. Daimon Kiyota would swim like a fish in Hell.

3519.Report: The plot becomes a knot. Someone hired the Phoenicians to hire the House-in-Exile to kill very small, very particular people. The mercenaries of Carthage rarely hold to any ethos other than profit (unless they have us all fooled…and anything is possible). I doubt they had a personal stake in the bombing. Likely, they were only working for top pay in wealth or favours. Likely, they've been storing up those favours for some time, based on their patterns. Likely, they are readying for a bigger move that has very little to do with Tokyo.

3529.Report: The model shivers. You used the machines of the Third Age. You used game pieces from a different board. Can the butterfly wings from a dream affect the storms of the waking world? Even the most advanced agent of chaos cannot know for certain. It is the prerogative of the Fool to repeat folly, and so must you continue to do as you have done. Agartha must not fall to the Filth. We are entering a new phase of our game. You will do the right thing. Or you will not.

3530.Report: You clip the noxious weeds. They grow back all the faster. Your only tool is the blade. Your only move is to cut. The game is simple, predictable. You will lose. You must change the game. You must warp the rules. We are Dragon, and we do not surrender to paradigms. Losing the game is a failure of audacity. We will change the rules in Tokyo.

3534.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3535.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3536.Report:
Hundreds of years ago, a King lay down to sleep, and he dreamed of a golden giant. When he woke, he ordered the statue built, for he was a pious man and he knew that his vision came from a higher power.
Men call it the Phra Phuttha Maha Suwan Patimakon. 
The king died and his kingdom faded and was forgotten. 
In another kingdom, another time, one of our agents covered the golden statue with a layer of stone and glass.
For 200 years, men passed the statue by, never knowing what lay beneath. It was no longer coveted, no longer threatened.
Then, just half a century ago, the stone was chipped away, the riches uncovered. Now it sits, in a gaudy temple, far from where it was born, to be stared out by tourists.
Gaia creates and men imitate. This was her warning to us. We choose to heed it or not.

3540.Report: The Fool's Dance is still your priority. Your stumbling might keep the sun rising. Sometimes motion is the only defiance toward maximum decay. And you keep running.

3541.Report: In Scandinavia, flesh eating lullabies crawl out of the wall of an old monastery when human hands touch the brick. This is happening now. Only you can stop it at the source, far-far away.

3542.Report:
Our current models indicate that your attempts to suppress the filth through conventional means have a 99.999999999% chance of failure.
Please note that our model has a 0.000000001% margin of error in these types of predictions.
More interesting is Ricky Pagan and the dancing he does. Interpreting the dance may be a key data point for future models.

3543.Report: The game has not yet changed. But it must, or you lose. For now you must keep playing the game. Keep cutting. Go beyond endurance, and then quite a bit further. Keep your mind on distant Tokyo.

3544.Report: The hungry lullabies in that Scandinavian monastery have gone dormant again. You ceased their feast of flesh without even setting foot there. Do you see now? Understanding opens like the hand of a vestigial limb your ancestors forgot. Warfare on three dimensions was just the tutorial for the coming battle. We stab a painting in a far away dream, to skewer the heart of the Beast at our door. Open your mind. It won't hurt a bit. That is a pleasant lie.

3547.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3548.Report: You could have let Kurt die. You did not. The gears of the supernal machine turn on such choices. Watch the branching variables that result from Kurt's life, from this moment on, and then reverse engineer an imaginary construct of the world that would have been without him. Such exercise builds the mental muscles you will need.

3550.Report:
Children understand that there is no such thing as a one-way connection. Everything flows into the future and everything flows back into the past. Fighting time is as ridiculous as fighting the tide.
The girl should have known who wrote the last entry in her diary. We do.

3551.Report:
Let me tell you a story.
A woman went hiking along the Appalachian Trail. For 2000 miles of loneliness she hiked, with nothing more than her bedroll and her backpack for company. Every night she would camp, sleep and continue on. She traveled this lonely trail for months.
When she returned home and developed the rolls of film on her camera, they were full of pictures of her, sleeping on her bedroll. Night after night. For months.
Our hiker story is better.

3552.Report:
Seeds sewn in October lie fallow until the spring comes again. The pumpkin man has his roots in hell and he returns every season as well. More often, in fact.
Reap the harvest today and sow the seeds of destruction tomorrow.

3553.Report:
In China, it is not uncommon for families to set a place at their tables for their ancestors to return and eat and drink. Donnie Bedloe was like these hungry ghosts, empty inside and with a craving that he could never fulfil.
Perhaps his bones line the walls of the academy, like so many others. Would that anger your ghost, do you think?

3554.Report:
Do you believe this story? I will tell you another.
A woman hates her husband. She is right to do so. He beats her and he shakes their child when it cries. Suggesting a better hunting, she convinces him to move to a new hut out in the forest. Then, while he sleeps after a day of hunting, she kills him.
She takes her child and leaves to return to her village. Behind her in the night, the hut burns to the ground. But the spirit of the husband returns to seek vengeance.
Your story is better.

3555.Report:
Let me tell you a story.
A man checks into a rehab clinic. He wants to be clean and free of drugs and to put his troubled soul at ease. But this man is important, too important to spend his life in sobriety. This man is a conduit.
Our agents find another man who looks and talks like him and we make the switch.
We drop him off at a cafe. He is late for a cliche.

3556.Report:
Some things die so that others may live. The world has always been like this. If the real Ellis Hill had been an antelope and the other a lion, would you feel outraged?
The model we are building counts you as variables. Does it make you uncomfortable to think that if you died, for many in the Dragon you would be a -1 that needed to be accounted for in the models?

3557.Report: The game has not yet changed. But it must, or you lose. For now you must keep playing the game. Keep cutting. Go beyond endurance, and then quite a bit further. Keep your mind on distant Tokyo.

3558.Report:
Our models are capable of predicting the end of any relationship to a high degree of accuracy. We can tell when couples are going to break up, we can tell when marriages are reaching their end and we can even tell when a partner is cheating - just by feeding their personality variables into our models.
Until now, our models likely could not have predicted this end to a relationship. This is good new information to feed them.

3559.Report:
If a man only needs one kidney to survive, why does this story terrify us so? We are always taught to live with what we have and be content with what we own. The body is a remarkably resilient thing, your body, even more so. 
Don't let yourself ever get caught by organ smugglers. They might be able to harvest you daily for the rest of their lives. It would not be a pleasant experience.

3560.Report:
Many people make the mistake of thinking that with the arrival of technology, fear is able to take on new shapes and forms. But fear has always taken whatever form it wishes. It was there in the dark woods and caves of our forefathers. It whispered in the corners of the huts of our ancestors.
As long as there is a space for it to exist in, there will always be fear. You are of the Dragon. Do not allow it space.

3562.Report:
A Venetian fisherman once pulled a locker from the bottom of the ocean. He couldn't open it, so he enlisted the aid of locksmith. The locksmith pried it open and was disappointed to find that it was full of waterlogged magnetic tapes. Together, fisherman and locksmith paid some local boys to dump it again. Paid in advance, the boys sold the tape as ribbons to unsuspecting tourists during carnivale.
When our model was updated with the tape fragment that we received, it read as such:
63 6f 6d 70 6c 65 74 65 20 6d 65 6e 74 61 6c 20 64 65 73 74 72 75 63 74 69 6f 6e 20 69 73 20 70 6f 73 73 69 62 6c 65 2e 20 54 68 65 20 6d 61 63 68 69 6e 65 20 69 73 20 69 6d 70 6f 72 74 61 6e 74 20 62 75 74 20 74 68 69 73 20 67 6c 69 74 63 68 20 69 73
Our models indicate that you have almost certainly returned from the machine with memory and personality intact. If this is not the case, please disregard future communication.

The locksmith pried it open and was disappointed to find that it was full of waterlogged magnetic tapes. Together, fisherman and locksmith paid some local boys to dump it again. I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

3566.Report:
Let me tell you a story from the future.
A security guard reads a book of spooky stories. One of them triggers a fear reaction - his pupils dilate and icy fingers seem to touch his spine. He shivers and wipes his eyes. In the space of that shiver, you are past him and into the maximum security area of Orochi Tower...

Stories are the purest form of telepathy. They allow us to communicate across space, but also across time and spirit. A skilled writer can communicate every skipped heartbeat, every fearful breath and every bloody wound. Words are power. Your future depends on them.

3567.Report:
Seeds sewn in October lie fallow until the spring comes again. The pumpkin man has his roots in hell and he returns every season as well. More often, in fact.
Reap the harvest today and sow the seeds of destruction tomorrow.

3568.Report:
We knew that Irusan could not be Irusan. He had the claws to scratch through the weakened world – a world in transition – but not the strength or the will. Legendary creatures are only as powerful as their grip over us. Irusan lingered only in the minds of a few stray cats.

And so the game began: to determine the true identity of this man, this killer, this counterfeiter. We wrote the evidence on the walls. We modelled a map on the ground. Each of us took turns, analysing the clues, eliminating the suspects.

Finally, I made my supposition: Dave Gardener in Egypt with the Stone of Bastet.

Yes, I am ashamed. But the game goes on without me.

3569.Report:
We knew that Irusan could not be Irusan. He had the claws to scratch through the weakened world – a world in transition – but not the strength or the will. Legendary creatures are only as powerful as their grip over us. Irusan lingered only in the minds of a few stray cats.

And so the game began: to determine the true identity of this man, this killer, this counterfeiter. We wrote the evidence on the walls. We modelled a map on the ground. Each of us took turns, analysing the clues, eliminating the suspects.

Finally, I made my supposition: Dave Gardener in Egypt with the Stone of Bastet.

Yes, I am ashamed. But the game goes on without me.

3570.Report:
Congratulations on entering your first scenario. The Council of Venice would like to remind you that by entering the scenario you have agreed to the follow the terms and conditions set forth in the EULA.
The EULA can be freely read at any time by locating grimoire 47 in The Sunken Library and perusing page 708.
The council thanks you for your co-operation.
Operator K

3572.Report: We know the value of butterfly wings. We know the danger. Who is Butterfly8? What wing flap was she sending out into the universe by fluttering the heart of such a tiny, scared soul as Yuichi?

3574.QuestName: The Echoing Doom of Solomon Island - Gold
3574.Report:
When you've done something enough, it becomes routine. Do it a few million more times, and it becomes instinct.
Have you wondered, perhaps, that the Mayan calendar has started anew? That we now have 13 more B'ak'tun where these monsters will return every year to stalk the earth. Perhaps it will all feel a little routine in years and decades to come. For now, hone your instincts.

3575.QuestName: The Echoing Doom of Egypt - Gold
3575.Report:
When you've done something enough, it becomes routine. Do it a few million more times, and it becomes instinct.
Have you wondered, perhaps, that the Mayan calendar has started anew? That we now have 13 more B'ak'tun where these monsters will return every year to stalk the earth. Perhaps it will all feel a little routine in years and decades to come. For now, hone your instincts.

3576.QuestName: The Echoing Doom of Transylvania - Gold
3576.Report:
When you've done something enough, it becomes routine. Do it a few million more times, and it becomes instinct.
Have you wondered, perhaps, that the Mayan calendar has started anew? That we now have 13 more B'ak'tun where these monsters will return every year to stalk the earth. Perhaps it will all feel a little routine in years and decades to come. For now, hone your instincts.

3577.Report:
Let me tell you a story.
Once there was a boy who didn't care for music. He asked for a bicycle for his birthday. He received a guitar. Eventually, he learned to play it and went on to become famous across the world. Some people called him The King.
He had a brother, stillborn according to all medical reports. This brother was carried to another land and given a new life and a new name. He became a businessman in Tokyo, and an important figure in the Tokyo aerospace industry. All his life, people would comment on his resemblance to The King.
He married a local woman and had a son that he named Ryuichi.
This is our model. Our labor bears fruit.

3578.Report:
Let me tell you a story.
A girl is punished by her father. In the beginning of winter, he carries her to a nearby lake and hangs her between two trees. Half of her body is submerged in the freezing water of the lake and half is left in the open air.
Slowly her submerged skin shrivels and blackens. The pain wounds her, tears her soul in two and with the eye that rots on her submerged face, she begins to see the shadows of the world beyond ours. Every touch of death, every ravage of time. On every living thing.
Her father returns and cuts her free. He gives her a drink of something wonderful that warms half of her body.
"Father, why was I punished?" she asks him, quietly.
"Punished? Why you have been blessed!" Loki said.

3582.Report: Daimon Kiyota. Records of his life are a mess or missing. His place in the model makes no sense. As near as I can tell, his grandfather muscled in on the organised crime of the 20s, after a visit to New York. But no records of any children. No records of his death. The Dragon should not trust him. All of his angles are wrong. Perhaps I am obsessing. We need to continue our investigations into Tokyo. We calculate that there is one yet living who can speak of the bomb and of Fear nothing, and he will surface shortly.

3583.Report: I do not trust Daimon Kiyota. I think it was a mistake to throw in with him. Find out all you can about him, and send in your impressions. Contact me directly.

3584.Report: We admire the Jingu. Museums are full of things to be admired. The Jingu were outdated in their own time. They are unbending, and will break in the gale wind. Now you must speak to the House-in-Exile. The Oni are the Jingu's opposite. They have no conviction, and become formless masses under pressure. Learn a lesson from each group that you meet. The Korinto-kai's lesson will be the most infuriating.

3585.Report: There will be eyes in the walls. There will be a sad effigy. You will have to decide between execution or tactical forgiveness. Enjoy your stay in Venice.

3586.Report: In Tokyo there are three groups who still play the supernal game on a broken game board: the fading samurai, the homeless demons, and the occult gangsters. Our lot is thrown in with the latter. Contact their leader, Daimon Kiyota. I want to know your impressions of him. I don't like the way his entropy eats the equations. Introduce yourself to the other gangs as well. It helps to see from all the perspectives. And beware the voice haunting the air waves.

3587.Report: Daimon Kiyota. Records of his life are a mess or missing. His place in the model makes no sense. As near as I can tell, his grandfather muscled in on the organised crime of the 20s, after a visit to New York. But no records of any children. No records of his death. The Dragon should not trust him. All of his angles are wrong. Perhaps I am obsessing. We need to continue our investigations into Tokyo. We calculate that there is one yet living who can speak of the bomb and of Fear nothing, and he will surface shortly.

3589.Report: The important pattern here is the shift in tone of the journal's final entry. Look about. Find the corresponding physical location where this change in perception took place.

3590.Report: Arturo's betrayal and change of heart were the most likely of the models. The intrigue and politics of this situation are just chess games and shadow puppet shows. Let it distract the others. Sarah is the important variable. How many hundreds have seen through her eyes? Follow the memories you once stole from her head, and find her.

3591.Report:
"I mean," said Alice, "that one can't help growing older." "One can't, perhaps," said Humpty Dumpty; "but two can. With proper assistance, you might have left off at seven." Someone is out there assisting others, passing out wooden kimonos. Find the white rabbit. When you jump through the looking glass, the broken shards will write secret words into your skin in ripping red. Find the answers. Feed your head. Feed your head.
By the by, this is not Bong Cha. 'scuse my intrusion. Wanted to try this on for size first. Feels good. Like a glove. Ain't I a stinker?

3592.Report: The bomb in Tokyo set off so many variables. Sarah is one that we could not predict, and therefore, she is one of the most precious. She becomes a fulcrum on which so many swing. So many paths lead to her mind. She is a living landscape. She is walking geomancy. How did she get this way? We must know.

3593.Report:
From Tyre to Byblos to Arwad to Sidon. Carthage never died. Looking for treachery? No need to seek something as exotic as us, it's much closer to home than you think. This struggle is unnecessary. We're already in your bed.

The Purple

3594.Report:
A system as compromised as a patchwork man is fascinating. Dangerously fascinating. The brain came from one distinct being. But what of the hands? Do they remember their old tasks? Do the organs feel nostalgia?

So many secrets can be tortured from the clay.

But the star that burns twice as bright burns half as long. The creature was a beautiful anomaly, but it played out its chaos. And now it rests. As it should.

The ages follow similar patterns. They awake, vivified, the same repeating patterns grafted together in different configurations. They play out their chaos. And then, they are put to rest.

3595.Report: There is a ghost in the system, and it's name is John. It has haunted the paradigm since the event in Tokyo. It vibrates like an inverse echo of the buzzing voice. The others will respond predictably: to neutralise the ghost. Find out what you can of John before they do.

3597.Report: A Dragon on the Trials of the Dragon. Fractals loop into fractals, and everything comes up Ouroboros. What did you learn in the Land Beyond the Forest? What will you take away? What will you unlearn? Fractals repeat. See how the little pieces form the same image in macro. Vampires stalk that land, but they are only tiny scales of one coil. That land is itself a vampire. The soil drank enough blood to get a taste. It wants the gore to spill. The system is tilted in favour of that outcome, in that place.

3598.Report: Our mutual siblings in red and blue underestimate the value of Mosul. We shall not make that mistake. There are secrets trapped in his growth rings.

3599.Report: The Oni smell potential gain. They flood this iteration of reality, bottlenecking in the niche their more entrenched siblings in the House-in-Exile already fill. What could be worth that aggravation? The migratory patterns of demons are enlightening. Incidentally, if you suddenly notice all the demons flee for home, that is a good indication that titanic trouble is imminent.

3601.Report: The Lion of Venice spies on itself. It flaps its wings. It is insane. Crazed things get put down, and who is setting themselves up to euthanize?

3604.Report: I do not trust Daimon Kiyota. I think it was a mistake to throw in with him. Find out all you can about him, and send in your impressions. Contact me directly.

3605.Report: Arturo's betrayal and change of heart were the most likely of the models. The intrigue and politics of this situation are just chess games and shadow puppet shows. Let it distract the others. Sarah is the important variable. How many hundreds have seen through her eyes? Follow the memories you once stole from her head, and find her.

3606.Report: The Filth is not a system of stasis, not a stagnating horror. It is dynamic. If it is changing, what is it changing into? What was the intent? Who did the intending? And is everything going according to their hypothetical plan? And if the Filth is changing into something else, what of its opposite – what of the rest of us?

3613.Report: We admire the Jingu. Museums are full of things to be admired. The Jingu were outdated in their own time. They are unbending, and will break in the gale wind. Now you must speak to the House-in-Exile. The Oni are the Jingu's opposite. They have no conviction, and become formless masses under pressure. Learn a lesson from each group that you meet. The Korinto-kai's lesson will be the most infuriating.

3614.Report: The mind is a tiny prison to be trapped in, especially with company. Sarah may fracture. She might even find some enlightenment without the burden of the self. We will contact Mei Ling. We must know more.

3615.Report: The bomb in Tokyo set off so many variables. Sarah is one that we could not predict, and therefore, she is one of the most precious. She becomes a fulcrum on which so many swing. So many paths lead to her mind. She is a living landscape. She is walking geomancy. How did she get this way? We must know.

3616.Report:
"I mean," said Alice, "that one can't help growing older." "One can't, perhaps," said Humpty Dumpty; "but two can. With proper assistance, you might have left off at seven." Someone is out there assisting others, passing out wooden kimonos. Find the white rabbit. When you jump through the looking glass, the broken shards will write secret words into your skin in ripping red. Find the answers. Feed your head. Feed your head.
By the by, this is not Bong Cha. 'scuse my intrusion. Wanted to try this on for size first. Feels good. Like a glove. Ain't I a stinker?

3617.Report: The White Rabbit seems to stand outside. What shields it? It must serve a powerful variable. Keep moving. It's beyond the first wall. We're a step behind. We need to be back to a step ahead. Send all info to me directly.

3619.Report: I would make a pun about how the best offence is a strong defence tower, but I am above such things. That an insane man like this Kurt Kuszczak would be the only one in his unit to survive, and continue to survive in that war zone, seems unlikely. There are those who hypothesise that insanity is a clumsy evolutionary step towards a new level of hyper-consciousness – an adaptation to surviving in a stranger and stranger world.

3620.Report:
What do you know about Faust? He was unhappy with his life, so he made a pact with the devil to exchange his soul for unlimited knowledge and worldly pleasures.
Some versions of the tale portray him as damned forever. Others portrayed him as repentant and welcomed into a divine embrace.
We wonder about the deal that Daimon Kiyota has made and whether he is damned or enlightened? Or both.

3622.Report: John can now manifest physically. But this is not his most dangerous attribute. We surmise that he is a result of the bomb. But our models indicate that he was not a planned result by the forces that put this in sway. John is an accident. He is an x-factor. And who better to understand and use x-factors than us?

3623.Report: John can now manifest physically. But this is not his most dangerous attribute. We surmise that he is a result of the bomb. But our models indicate that he was not a planned result by the forces that put this in sway. John is an accident. He is an x-factor. And who better to understand and use x-factors than us?

3624.Report: A strange signal just took over my phone. There was a voice. There was a chuckle. It said, "Chuck," and I think it referred to the child. The child shed a single tear down his cheek. Do you understand the significance? We need to find out who John is. You and I must be the ones to discover this. Do you understand?

3625.Report: A strange signal just took over my phone. There was a voice. There was a chuckle. It said, "Chuck," and I think it referred to the child. The child shed a single tear down his cheek. Do you understand the significance? We need to find out who John is. You and I must be the ones to discover this. Do you understand?

3627.Report:
Our models predicted this. A second line of defence for the mother - less refined and more brutish. Careful amalgamations of silica and elements, charged by anima and given a shambling semblance of existence. They are strong, they are efficient and they have no place in our models. 
Everything we know points to them appearing in places of where the filth has been spotted - all the anomalies that you have been investigating, in other words. Transylvania and Egypt and Solomon Island - probably Tokyo as well, but you don't have clearance to go there yet.
Our data set needs cleaning up. Remove these elements whenever you encounter them.

3630.Report: Gaia made her proto-defenders impressively. But we are the revised models, Mark II, the software update. The lumbering guardians have no place anymore, and there is no shame in that. They did well in their own time. There may come a time when new defenders remove us from this world.

3631.Report: Gaia made her proto-defenders impressively. But we are the revised models, Mark II, the software update. The lumbering guardians have no place anymore, and there is no shame in that. They did well in their own time. There may come a time when new defenders remove us from this world.

Our data set needs cleaning up. Remove these elements whenever you encounter them.

3641.Report:
Our models predicted this. A second line of defence for the mother - less refined and more brutish. Careful amalgamations of silica and elements, charged by anima and given a shambling semblance of existence. They are strong, they are efficient and they have no place in our models. 
Everything we know points to them appearing in places of where the filth has been spotted - all the anomalies that you have been investigating, in other words. Transylvania and Egypt and Solomon Island - probably Tokyo as well, but you don't have clearance to go there yet.
Our data set needs cleaning up. Remove these elements whenever you encounter them.

3646.Report:
As each camera comes online, our vision becomes clearer. Your part is to wipe the eyes, cleanse the throat, wash the ears and clear the senses. 
Your actions birth the future. Every variable is the parent of a thousand afterbirth-soaked possibilities.

3647.Report:
Does it ever make you wonder? The web that the universe spins for you is a vast one. A lonely girl in Tokyo reaches onto the internet – searching for kindred spirits to connect with while she watches over her sweetly damaged brother.

One of them works for the corporation that seems to be sitting at the heart of the spider web. Every delicate thread is a connection to something greater and every single thread contributes just enough strength to keep the structure intact.

Continue to follow these threads and this web will one day catch you a butterfly.

3648.Report:
The human mind spins such pretty webs.
The beauty of chaos is the chaos of beauty. Perhaps you understand a little more of the world you cannot see. Patterns that cannot be seen and yet patterns that dictate. It was inevitable that they would lead you to this point. It was inevitable that the killer was not waiting at the end of your trail.
The current model invokes Aesop and calls you "Tortoise".

3653.Report: The rabbit stalks the wreckage of Fear Nothing and the Morninglight. Damage control? All signs point to yes. Masao Tanaka could not see where his daughter had gone, because he does not believe in those places. A death cult with loose ends. A botched bomb. A killer cleaning up. A lost daughter. And the suffering children. Carry the zeros, complete the equation. Find the safehouses.

3654.Report: Fear Nothing. The Morninglight. Orochi. Their angles align. Jake Hama does not pretend at incompetence. He is the real thing. We could disregard him, going forward, but he is the Fool in its most base aspect. By his very irrelevance, he will trip the larger equations in ways more relevant figures would not be allowed. We'll be seeing him again.

3655.Report: The AEGIS systems were developed to stay ahead of the evolving Filth. The Filth evolve. But they did not start at the same place or time or change at the same rate. Divergent lines. Some older than others. Some from different sources than others. So where did this mutant ape come from?

3656.Report: I will tell you the story of the loneliest whale. There is a whale. It swims through the ocean. For one reason or another – perhaps it is malformed or a hybrid – it calls out in a voice of a higher frequency than the rest of its fellows. It calls and calls. No one can hear it. No one can answer. The calls grow more strained, stretched with despair. The loneliest whale mutely screams into the abyss. The end. The Black Signal abruptly changes frequency at the mention of two names. This shift is beyond human hearing, but it is definite. The names are: Naonomi and Kaoru. You are on the right trail.

3658.Report: The tower is a the middle finger tempting the wrath of the sky gods. All calculations meet there. When our window opens, we must be swift.

3660.Report: The information in Dave Screed's publication forms an odd system. It is shotgun paranoia. Occasionally he is right, but not often for the reasons he thinks, and he is right more often than he should be by pure chance. But there is some bravery there. How frustrating it must be, to enter an endless cave with only a flickering, unreliable flashlight. His magazine makes for entertaining reading. I think I have had enough Time Cube theory. So much obnoxious noise to read through to get to that one sentence of ultimate truth. Can you guess which one?

3665.Report: The rabbit stalks the wreckage of Fear Nothing and the Morninglight. Damage control? All signs point to yes. Masao Tanaka could not see where his daughter had gone, because he does not believe in those places. A death cult with loose ends. A botched bomb. A killer cleaning up. A lost daughter. And the suffering children. Carry the zeros, complete the equation. Find the safehouses.

3673.Report: A horrific journey. Ship of Fools? Hieronymus Bosch. Yes. It fits. But what was the vessels origin point?

3674.Report: The Filth are evolving. But they did not start at the same place or time or change at the same rate. Divergent lines. Some older than others. Some from different sources than others. So where did this mutant ape come from?

3675.Report:
We are the Secret Santa. The cadaver of Saint Nicholas affects key points in history, centuries after the man died. We have followed along, making adjustments. We tempted the sailors of Bari to sack Myra in 1087. We played a small role in the conspiracy that turned the Church against the Templars in 1314. We warned the Phoenicians that the Illuminati were coming to filch their half of the cadaver, from Bari, in 1943.
She who controls the Manna, controls the universe. Or so you'd think by how they all scramble for it. Incidentally, we convinced the Coca-Cola company to redraw the image of Santa Clause, to the colours of our choosing, for reasons you are not yet at liberty to know. Life tastes good.

3685.Report: Fear Nothing. The Morninglight. Orochi. Their angles align. Jake Hama does not pretend at incompetence. He is the real thing. We could disregard him, going forward, but he is the Fool in its most base aspect. By his very irrelevance, he will trip the larger equations in ways more relevant figures would not be allowed. We'll be seeing him again.

For one reason or another – perhaps it is malformed or a hybrid – it calls out in a voice of a higher frequency than the rest of its fellows. It calls and calls. No one can hear it. No one can answer. The calls grow more strained, stretched with despair. The loneliest whale mutely screams into the abyss. The end. The Black Signal abruptly changes frequency at the mention of two names. This shift is beyond human hearing, but it is definite. The names are: Naonomi and Kaoru. You are on the right trail.

3687.Report: The tower is a the middle finger tempting the wrath of the sky gods. All calculations meet there. When our window opens, we must be swift.

3688.Report: Daimon says the moment is at hand. You are to assist him. A demon and a samurai will be ready to come to blows. It is our task to turn that aggression to better ends. The tower grows impatient.

3689.Report: A knife called Famine scrapes the bottom of the bowl called Hunger. Scritch-scritch. It tells a story. His horns hurt her womb, so she spat him out far, far too early, into the cold. He grew shaggy fur to make due. He drank black milk from her breast, gelid and bitter. It was hard to swallow. So he made himself colder, made himself more bitter. He envied the warmth of the children born to middle world. In the underworld, he clutched dark humour like a safety blanket, and he found a way to show it to the warm children, in the season when the underworld is closest.

3691.Report: All three lines converge. Daimon Kiyota has made an excellent fulcrum. The Tower is open. The Tower is no less dangerous. In our history, we have needed Blue and Red to battle. Now they must work together, and it is up to us to make it so. We are the impossible force that makes demons and samurai shake hands. In that deadly handshake, we avert the apocalypse. Or we shape it into an apocalypse of our choosing.

3694.Report: Can you hear it? Hippity-hoppity. A free radical spoiling the meat molecules. The rabbit killer is in the building. Do not delay. On to Lilith. You are a free radical too, spinning and spoiling systems much larger and more important than you. There is power in being small, in having something missing from one's totality. Spin.

3695.Report:
Jeepers creepers! Hang on to your stilts. There's been a change to the management. Now I have a smartphone, HO-HO-HO! This cat is going to be a little more hands on from the here on. I'm your dingle dangler now. No fortune cookie static! This is the nonsense written with straight razors. The dragon shimmies down the sky ladder, and the dragon evolves – it grew a new mouth. Now, you need to flop in the shade until you beat the heat. Dig? Earth-bound angels and super corporations and the world fuzz are coming down on you. But don't get grummy! The Blues and Reds will be all sour at the exposure. But that's just another bit of chaos for us to find opportunity in. We'll be hitting on eight in no time. Marquard probably thinks he got away on the sly. But he's inherited you and me and a sack full of cackling woe. Whoa! Word to the wise: consider making a change to your face and hair. The night has a thousand eyes.

D.K.

3698.Report: The Orochi have somehow made these portable anima wells so that they are only attuned to their Mitsubachi. It is another puzzle for us to finagle. But the prize is worth the toil. A most painful form of teleportation.

3700.Report: All three lines converge. Daimon Kiyota has made an excellent fulcrum. The Tower is open. The Tower is no less dangerous. In our history, we have needed Blue and Red to battle. Now they must work together, and it is up to us to make it so. We are the impossible force that makes demons and samurai shake hands. In that deadly handshake, we avert the apocalypse. Or we shape it into an apocalypse of our choosing.

Jeepers creepers! Hang on to your stilts. There's been a change to the management. Now I have a smartphone, HO-HO-HO! This cat is going to be a little more hands on from the here on. I'm your dingle dangler now. No fortune cookie static! This is the nonsense written with straight razors. The dragon shimmies down the sky ladder, and the dragon evolves – it grew a new mouth. Now, you need to flop in the shade until you beat the heat. Dig? Earth-bound angels and super corporations and the world fuzz are coming down on you. But don't get grummy! The Blues and Reds will be all sour at the exposure. But that's just another bit of chaos for us to find opportunity in. We'll be hitting on eight in no time. Marquard probably thinks he got away on the sly. But he's inherited you and me and a sack full of cackling woe. Whoa!
D.K.

3702.Report: Can you hear it? Hippity-hoppity. A free radical spoiling the meat molecules. The rabbit killer is in the building. Do not delay. On to Lilith. You are a free radical too, spinning and spoiling systems much larger and more important than you. There is power in being small, in having something missing from one's totality. Spin.

3705.Report:
There are two stories. This is the first story. There was once a magician, peddling illusions and chicanery on the road. No one knew how he performed his tricks, how he could vanish from one place, and materialise in another. They did not know his secret, that he was in fact a set of twins.

This is the second story. We once employed a talented killer we called Dragon's Tooth. Many came to dread the sight of her Noh mask and her hungry blade. If one were to look, one might determine that both the Templars and the Illuminati had identical assassins within their ranks.

One of these stories is true. Both are related.

3707.Report: Sometimes, the road is the dragon's tongue. You can hear the stories when the breath of the wind plays off it. We have heard the stories of the successful walking corpse that was Sandy Jansen, who died and rose again as the living Moose. We know of the black dog that tailed him on the desolate, cornfield roads in Central Illinois. We know the family he helped from a feral pack of vampires in Mexico. We know of the Vodou mambo who promised him a favour of eternal gratitude in Louisiana. We know what the writing on the wall said in the motel room in Nevada. Does Moose follow the weird, or does the weird follow him?

3709.Report:
There are two stories. This is the first story. There was once a magician, peddling illusions and chicanery on the road. No one knew how he performed his tricks, how he could vanish from one place, and materialise in another. They did not know his secret, that he was in fact a set of twins.

This is the second story. We once employed a talented killer we called Dragon's Tooth. Many came to dread the sight of her Noh mask and her hungry blade. If one were to look, one might determine that both the Templars and the Illuminati had identical assassins within their ranks.

One of these stories is true. Both are related.

3710.Report:
You're hitting on all eight! When Johnny-come-Filthy starts blowing things down, we got to keep the girl and the box safe by the hairs of our chinny-chin-chins. While they're in the basement, we're ducky. You don't have to have control to have control (amateur mistake!). These days, we open the doors, the ins and outs of Kaidan. No one else can get the box out of here without us. And right now, they're all looking at that box. They barely notice the girl. They're missing the point. The box is a choice bit of calico, but the girl's the darb! The box gives her context. What is she? If she controls the box… We've got to noodle that one. Part of a larger messy goo of question that started coagulating in my brain bowl, one night, when the Pachinko machine was going ding-ding-ding-ding. A chicken and the egg sort of thing. What makes what first, and does the question even matter if it's happened more than once? Like a billion times already…and…don't make me explain it! It's all chaos in my noggin right now. So we make it up as we go.

D.K.

3717.QuestName: It Fell From the Outer Dark
3717.Report:
The child brought a hand to his mouth and wriggled his fingers. Then the child allowed himself the luxury of a shudder and a tear. I hope you recognise the gravity of the moth wing-clap that preludes the typhoon that preludes darkness, stagnant wetness, and the rising of crawling things.

We are the chaos that preludes balance — the shock that vivifies a dying world with sores that are cities. The lancing cut. The relieving pain. The bad blood flows out.

This Eidolon of the Outer Dark represents chaos that preludes nihilistic oblivion — the plague breath that putrefies the universe into a vermiculated graveyard with planets that are mausoleums.

3718.QuestName: It Fell From the Outer Dark Revisited
3718.Report:

3732.QuestName: Bird of the Zero Point Pathogen
3732.Report: The bird lives. The bird dies. The bird lives again. Time is a flat line, to us, because our limited organs can only perceive it as such. Deja-vu happens when two or more events happen at the same point on the perceived line, but raised upwards and outward on an invisible axis. From our perspective, one point blocks the other. Yet some atrophied section of our brain quivers, pulses, tries to tell us there is another point behind.

3733.QuestName: Bird of the Zero Point Pathogen Revisited
3733.Report:

3761.Report: Strange. We predicted a concentrated manifestation of malice rising this time tomorrow. We will adjust the models.

D.K.

3805.Report:
Our girl is still spinning the cogs. And you saw what the grand muckity slime did about that, eh? We poked. They reacted. So now we know more about the girl and the box. And you got to play with all those experiments. Ain't science fun?
D.K.

3806.Report:
Our girl is still spinning the cogs. And you saw what the grand muckity slime did about that, eh? We poked. They reacted. So now we know more about the girl and the box. And you got to play with all those experiments. Ain't science fun?
D.K.

3807.Report:
Orochi will take the media. The Illuminati will take the government. The Templars will take everyone else. It is in all their interests to keep the world uninformed. Do not mistake us for allies in the conspiracy of silence. We sew lips, yes, but only when it inspires thought.
Let them play their propaganda games. Let them think we are on their side, or better yet, that we are random, and foolish, and insane.
Let them assume we have never done laundry in New York.
In the meantime, a madman will listen to his informant. He will type furiously while being watched and protected. He will never ask himself who, or how, or why. He will simply write what he knows.
My name is not on his subscriber list and neither is yours. But that doesn't matter. After all, what's in a name?
1036T88612-1

3808.QuestName: Crossroad of the Worlds - Nightmare Revisited
3808.Report:

1036T88612-1

3809.Report:
I thought all you Bees-Knees types came by your condition via the mysterious goddess machine herself. But word has it, this Lorraine Maillard got her bee put in her by the Council of Venice mooks. Then, she ups and figures out the impossible, how to give herself the big sleep. That'd be unbelievable, but I know a thing or two about normies doing the impossible and punching above their weight. Have the right thing driving you, and anything's possible. Just took her thirty years. The Pachinko machine says she's connected to the Atlantic Island Park – says something bad happened there. Real bad.

D.K.

3816.QuestName: Neuromancy and the Art of Making Friends
3816.Report:
Harumi is it? Rumy-Rum. Her head rattles like a pachinko machine. Bing-bing-bing! All that tilt. The caffeine holds her smile up pretty good. She's got just the right balance of damage to keep going in the most unlikely of ways. But if that chaos ever slips… Don't let the cute face fool you too much. She wanted something more than just a connection to cameras and satellites. Don't know what, but I feel that itch. Never flimflam a flimflammer.

D.K.

3817.Report:
Awww, the little mech wants to be your friend. Maybe it wants to be a real little boy. You wonder how a dummy gets to wanting that? What's in those Orochi machines? How come their scientists get to the end of their math homework without showing their work? I got a guess. I think you'll find out for certain if you keep following in this crazy mech's wake.

D.K.

3820.Report:
We have little interest in mad scientists and possessed murderous cyborgs. The Orochi have become desperate, yet they harness little patience for rational and cohesive solutions. Instead, they construct these monstrosities which only succeed in tearing them apart from within. 
 
D.K.

3821.Report:
Jung is as deadly as it gets. Don't believe me? I'm going to tell you a bedtime story. 
 
Imagine you're a goon from the Fear Nothing Foundation. The bosses told you to pick up the big-headed freak kid. Piece of cake. You strut up, towering over the little one sitting on the seesaw (and really, is there anything lonelier than one person sitting on a seesaw?). You kind of enjoy the imbalance of power. You grin. 
The boy looks up at you with a face a kindergartner should not be able to make. You feel undead moths flutter inside you. You feel transparent. Naked. The stomach dropping sensation that someone knows that secret about you, the one you prayed no one would ever find out, the one that you try to forget, because it shatters the self-image you have of yourself. 
 
"Please, sir, would you do me the kindness of forgetting how to breathe?" 
 
Where'd he get that British accent? 
 
You try to laugh, but can't draw in the air. What the $@#%? You try again. Your muscles don't remember how. Impossible! We've all done it at one time or another, when we are alone with our thoughts. We become hyper-aware of our breathing. Each breath becomes a conscious effort. We control how deep, how long. For just a second, we have the fear that if we stop making the effort, we'll stop breathing and die. But of course, we keep breathing anyway. 
 
Except now. The fear's come true. You fall to your knees. The blood vessels in your head are about to burst. The world turns sideways. And the last thing you see is that little boy staring at you. Staring. 
 
Sweet dreams. 
 
D.K.

3827.Report:
Jack be nimble. Jack be dead. He took the big sleep. And he lives on as a meaty dream in a metal body. I'd like to chinwag with Jack sometime. I have so many questions.

D.K.

3828.Report:
Tit for tat. Kaoru is sweet like that. You brought her the key, and now she just sent me some juicy tidbits on her dead guest. One of the Druids. They're a minor faction in the Council of Venice – not on the same playing field as the Reds, Blues, and Greens. Interesting that they'd come all the way out here. The others probably underestimate them. Small timers. But then, they all underestimated me and the Korito-kai. Starting small gives you a certain angle and perspective that you can convert into wisdom. Dig? Yeah. You dig.

D.K.

3829.QuestName: A Little Bit Me, A Little Bit Jung
3829.Report:
Little boy Jung. He's got the key. He can walk in and out of minds. He gets behind the curtain. He gets the teacher's edition of reality. Some days, the Pachinko machine says I should go have a sit down with him. Other days, the Pachinko machine says that's the biggest mistake I could make. Now that would be the most dangerous session of seesaw ever. How can I resist?

D.K.

3832.Report: The scent of burnt sacrifices stays with one for a while. Seriously. The flaking burnt particles of body catch in the nasal cavity and linger. It's a bad taste to have in the back of the throat. If it gets too bad, give the enemy gaudy names. That usually helps.

3833.Report: How does one sift through the wreckage of Doctor Klein's mind to find one disturbing thing among the ruins? He caught a glimpse of something, something that disconcerts his would-be masters, something even they cannot control.

3834.Report: We cracked open One Thousand and One Nights and skipped to the end. Aladdin is not your friend. Not having a name is a sort of freedom.

3837.QuestName: Beneath You It Eats Its Name
3837.Report: Solomon contained the uncontrollable. He trapped the Unbound. Myth distorts in the ripples of time, but if we are tracking this correctly, the Unbound was imprisoned and left beneath the Black Pyramid in the Third Age. Is this correct? Was it actually Solomon who did the deed? If so, he was a man who learnt not only longevity, but how to hop from Age to Age, to retain his individuality when the hourglass resets.

3839.Report: Go ahead and get the tablets translated, but we already smell Solomon's involvement. Such a clever one. We want to replicate his results, but we could never trap his movements into a proper model.

3840.Report: Sources say you do not exist anymore. You have gone to nowhere. Contact us when you get back.

3850.Report: Your pattern has been erratic lately. That is not always a bad thing. We would like to see you in Seoul soon, and discuss it further.

3860.Report:
Hundreds of years ago, a King lay down to sleep, and he dreamed of a golden giant. When he woke, he ordered the statue built, for he was a pious man and he knew that his vision came from a higher power.
Men call it the Phra Phuttha Maha Suwan Patimakon. 
The king died and his kingdom faded and was forgotten. 
In another kingdom, another time, one of our agents covered the golden statue with a layer of stone and glass.
For 200 years, men passed the statue by, never knowing what lay beneath. It was no longer coveted, no longer threatened.
Then, just half a century ago, the stone was chipped away, the riches uncovered. Now it sits, in a gaudy temple, far from where it was born, to be stared out by tourists.
Gaia creates and men imitate. This was her warning to us. We choose to heed it or not.

3861.Report:
Hundreds of years ago, a King lay down to sleep, and he dreamed of a golden giant. When he woke, he ordered the statue built, for he was a pious man and he knew that his vision came from a higher power.
Men call it the Phra Phuttha Maha Suwan Patimakon. 
The king died and his kingdom faded and was forgotten.

3864.Report:
Our models predicted this. A second line of defence for the mother - less refined and more brutish. Careful amalgamations of silica and elements, charged by anima and given a shambling semblance of existence. They are strong, they are efficient and they have no place in our models. 
Everything we know points to them appearing in places of where the filth has been spotted - all the anomalies that you have been investigating, in other words. Transylvania and Egypt and Solomon Island - probably Tokyo as well, but you don't have clearance to go there yet.
Our data set needs cleaning up. Remove these elements whenever you encounter them.

3917.Report:
When you've done something enough, it becomes routine. Do it a few million more times, and it becomes instinct.
Have you wondered, perhaps, that the Mayan calendar has started anew? That we now have 13 more B'ak'tun where these monsters will return every year to stalk the earth. Perhaps it will all feel a little routine in years and decades to come. For now, hone your instincts.

3931.Report:
I hope your employers do not mind that I borrow their frequency in order to congratulate you. The machine is a modern marvel, designed to challenge, yes, but also to teach and sharpen. I hope that you are paying attention to the lesson you are learning here. I hope that you are growing sharp as well. The council will always have a use for sharp blades.
Congratulations once again on your success,
Arturo

4007.Report: Thank you for your contribution and efforts in cleansing this area.  A reward and cash bonus have been credited to your account.

4008.Report: Thank you for your contribution and efforts in cleansing this area.  A reward and cash bonus have been credited to your account.

4020.Report: This Carmen Preda has proven valuable to our efforts. The road now leads us to Tokyo — but before that road can be traveled, one must first speak with the Council of Venice. This shall be no easy task, yet where one finds a challenge, one may also find reward.

4026.QuestName: Bird of the Zero Point Pathogen
4026.Report:
The bird lives. The bird dies. The bird lives again. Time is a flat line, to us, because our limited organs can only perceive it as such. Deja-vu happens when two or more events happen at the same point on the perceived line, but raised upwards and outward on an invisible axis. From our perspective, one point blocks the other. Yet some atrophied section of our brain quivers, pulses, tries to tell us there is another point behind.

The bird lives. The bird dies. The bird lives again. Time is a flat line...

4041.Report: What could have been an impressive device, has disappointed and proven itself useless. However, this Kurt may prove useful. Perhaps we can learn what he knows about the downfall of Tokyo, or at the very least — who the players in this twisted game may be.

4043.Report:
Orochi will take the media. The Illuminati will take the government. The Templars will take everyone else. It is in all their interests to keep the world uninformed. Do not mistake us for allies in the conspiracy of silence. We sew lips, yes, but only when it inspires thought.

Let them play their propaganda games. Let them think we are on their side, or better yet, that we are random, and foolish, and insane.

Let them assume we have never done laundry in New York.

In the meantime, a madman will listen to his informant. He will type furiously while being watched and protected. He will never ask himself who, or how, or why. He will simply write what he knows.

My name is not on his subscriber list and neither is yours. But that doesn't matter. After all, what's in a name?

1036T88612-1

4045.Report: I wish to inform you personally; your faction handler no longer exists. Please wait for further updates.

4046.Report: Your report on Faust Capitol is concerning. Through a series of small actions, one is capable of achieving bigger results. It seems the silent and small actions of the butterfly's wings have created an unforeseen storm. The pieces have been slowly culminating and now the butterfly has transformed yet again — this cannot be a good sign.

4047.Report: The Manticore Research Group is the definition of chaos. A chaos that has spread from their creations and turned onto its makers.

4048.Report:
Continue your mission and file your reports? 

Remind me again what these reports are pertaining to? 

I feel as if I can vaguely remember...as if everything is a distant dream.

4049.Report: You impress us with your ability to survive such a game show. Your knack for perseverance far out ways your knack for finding yourself in such uncanny situations. Continue ascending the tower and keep us informed.

4050.Report: Finding how each piece fits into the puzzle is what allows us to create the whole picture. The Sargasso Sea, the Enchanted Forest, and the Sycoil corporation are all the pieces coming together to create the grand design.

4051.Report: You did well in surviving Váli's monstrosities. Continue your ascension of the tower and keep us informed of further findings.

4052.Report: We find it repulsing the populace entertains these food products. The temples of our bodies remain balanced by the nourishment we put within. Continue on your path.

4054.Report: A place of peace, once disturbed — will leave a scar. But even scars can bring about a new kind of beauty. Although the temple gardens have been disturbed, the beauty will flourish upon its grounds again; and those who have seen it before and after, will be at peace with what you have done on this day.

4056.Report: It is always better to light a candle than to curse the darkness. Sometimes it is wise to do both. We commemorate you and your actions, the temple gardens needed a soul such as yours on this day.

4064.Report: We commemorate you in keeping honor within the temple's walls. Such an onslaught could have destroyed the very thing that many hold dear.

4073.Report:
Let me tell you a story.

A girl is punished by her father. In the beginning of winter, he carries her to a nearby lake and hangs her between two trees. Half of her body is submerged in the freezing water of the lake and half is left in the open air.

Slowly her submerged skin shrivels and blackens. The pain wounds her, tears her soul in two and with the eye that rots on her submerged face, she begins to see the shadows of the world beyond ours. Every touch of death, every ravage of time. On every living thing.

Her father returns and cuts her free. He gives her a drink of something wonderful that warms half of her body.

"Father, why was I punished?" she asks him, quietly.
"Punished? Why you have been blessed!" Loki said.

4075.Report: A knife scrapes the bottom of the bowl. Scritch-scritch. It tells a story. His horns hurt her womb, so she spat him out far, far too early, into the cold. He grew shaggy fur to make due. He drank black milk from her breast, gelid and bitter. It was hard to swallow. So he made himself colder, made himself more bitter. He envied the warmth of the children born to middle world. In the underworld, he clutched dark humour like a safety blanket, and he found a way to show it to the warm children, in the season when the underworld is closest.
